meanings.definition: Snedded (verb): past tense of sned, meaning to cut off or remove the side shoots or branches from a tree or plant.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I snedded the overgrown bushes in my garden.
meanings.sent2: The gardener snedded the tree to help it grow better.
meanings.sent3: After I snedded the plant, it looked much neater and healthier.
meanings.sent4: She snedded away the unnecessary branches, like cutting away worries.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the snedded branches hitting the ground echoed through the garden.

meanings.definition: Snedded (adjective): having been pruned or trimmed by snedding.
meanings.sent1: The snedded tree looked more orderly and tidy in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The snedded shrubs added a neat touch to the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The snedded plants seemed to stand taller and prouder.
meanings.sent4: Her snedded hair framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The snedded hedge created a perfect boundary for the yard.

meanings.definition: Snedded (noun): the act of snedding, typically done to promote growth or improve the appearance of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The snedded of the bushes made them look more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the snedded process as it made her garden look better.
meanings.sent3: The snedded of the trees was like giving them a haircut.
meanings.sent4: The snedded of the flowers brought out their natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The snedded of the plants was a labor of love for the gardener.
